page.title: 13 The New Inn Padbury
page.content: The pub is about 150 years old.It was converted from 3 cottages.It got its name because it was built on a new road,now A413,between Padbury & Stowe planed by the Duke of Buckingham as part of his scheme for a direct route from Stowe to London. OPENING HOURS mon - sat 10.00 14.30;18.00 - 23.00. Sun 12.00 - 15.00 & 07.00 - 22.30. Mr Nicholas Hoddy, the land lord calls "last orders"at closing time.Beer is supplied by the Aylesbury Brewery Co. On Mondays.Draught bitter costs 78p a pint.Sprits cost 60p a measure. A selection of bottled beers & soft drinks are sold,as well as crisps, nuts & chocolate. There are usually between 50 - 60 customers in the pub each day.There are 2 darts and 2 domino teams.The pub often runs the bar at functions.
